author: holiman
content: Well... "We" as in "me" focus on mainnet, nothing else.

author: holiman
content: Anyway, even if we're not going ahead with eof this time around, I think we made great progress during the last two weeks. Thanks and congrats for this, I had a lot of fun <@403707149043105803> <@508125616940515329> <@543900561460822016> <@1011612262743679036> -- I think the implementations finally ended up pretty close, maybe, just maybe, even in consensus.

author: smartprogrammer
content:
Guys,
What is the status of 3860 in the eof tests?
1. Without 3860
2. With 3860 but based on old spec (without https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/6249)
3. With updated 3860 (with https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/6249)
<@425274498732916736>

author: chfast
content: Tests in ethereum/tests, branch 'develop' (default) in EIPTests/stEIP3540 are based on the "new" unified spec and without 3860.

author: chfast
content: Once the 3860 is merged in geth we will probably update the tests.

author: smartprogrammer
content: So tests assume shanghaicore + eof but without 3860?

author: chfast
content:
This is also the question how do we want to continue testing?
- Shanghai+EIP3540
- Shanghai+eof1
- Cancun

author: smartprogrammer
content: it makes sense since we still dont know what goes into cancun

author: chfast
content: I maybe would call it `Shanghai+EOFv1` but looks like the best option to me.

author: lightclient
content: yeah i can add support for that

author: gcolvin
content: I'm referring to things like cryptographic work.  I don't know how many people that is, but I recall that you and I decided that the gas went overwhelmingly to I/O, but that we were going to work on optimizing computation anyway.   This was about two years ago when I was working on TurboGeth.

author: _shemnon
content: Optimizing computation opens the door for on-chain crypto validation without precompiles.

author: sendmoodz
content: continuing eof discussion from acd channel <@403707149043105803>

author: marioevz
content:
I uploaded a new version of EOF tests on the execution python test specs here: https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/pull/23

There are only 4 failing tests for geth at the moment, for which I could not produce test vectors, but in total there were 1886 tests we are now able to produce and package in this file
